_comment: This data is an early work-in-progress and contains errors. Produced by @michaelh at Discuss and Discover SuttaCentral forum - please get in touch! Finished code forthcoming.

Qualities that a mendicant lacks [an10.9: teaching Dhamma to the assembly with assurance
staying in the wilderness, in remote lodgings
direct meditative experience of the peaceful liberations that are formless, transcending form
realization of the undefiled freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom in this very life
living having realized it with their own insight due to the ending of defilements
Qualities that a mendicant should fulfil: teaching Dhamma to the assembly with assurance
becoming an expert in the training
living in the wilderness, in remote lodgings
living having realized the ending of defilements
Qualities that a complete mendicant has: teaching Dhamma to the assembly with assurance
being an expert in the monastic law
living in the wilderness, in remote lodgings
living having realized the ending of defilements
